metadata.title: Putting Feelings Into a Moment, Part 4

tracks.text: She looks out the window at day break
Silhouettes of Towa, Kei, Rakuro and Rei stand in front of portraits of their SLF characters Pencilgon, Oikatzo, Sunraku, and Psyger-0.
Text, Original Work, Katarina, Ryosuke Fuji. Serialized by Kodansha in Weekly Shounen Magazine
Rakuro wears a VR headset. The ID Shard, a diamond shaped pendant, swings in darkness.
Thirdrema, a western style town, stands at the foot of a hill with a castle at the top.
The sun sets and day turns to night.
Rakuro turns into Sunraku, who wields twin marsh daggers
Pencilgon descends to the ground and strikes with a spear
Katzo draws a red fist and black fist together, and her fists burst crimson.
Emul, Elke, Vash, Bilac, and Peitz walk along the Rabbituza palace verandah.
Psyger-0 and Psyger-100 stand back to back in a board room
Setsuna walks. Beyond her is the gnarled tree, high cliffs, and full moon.
Wethermon, a metal samurai, stares at us with glowing eyes. Fire licks his arms, shoulders, and stomach.
Kirin, a metal horse, rears in front of a red moon
Sunraku holds a two handed long sword and strikes at shadowy ghouls that surround him in a misty, purple forest.
Dozens of shadowy figures stand on outcroppings. Their eyes glow red.
Pencilgon swings a spear in mist
A headless horse and horseman gallop. She strikes
Katzo does a flying back flip over skeletal monsters
Wethermon draws a sword. The moon reflects in a muddy puddle. A drop splashes. Psyger-0 holds a sword, her long red plume blowing in the wind.
In a library, a girl with long pink braids and wide, green eyes smiles widely and reaches out a hand.
The Rebirth Tearjewel lands on Sunraku's abs and glows
Sunraku grips a curved dagger. Wearing a beetle helmet and diamond shaped pendant, he runs forward. Katzo with red fists and Pencilgon with a spear run with him.
In slow motion, they approach the samurai. The world turns red.
Text, 18, Putting Feelings Into a Moment, Part 4
He grabs the Tearjewel and tosses it in the air
The Tearjewel drops and lands on Sunraku's chest
Wethermon drives his sword into the ground.
He jumps up and equips his moonblades
Sunraku leaps over the slash and strikes Wethermon, critical
With Divine LifeSalve, he wakes up with half HP
Golem Kirin's foot descends on Katzo.
Kirin stomps. Katzo flies through the air. She tosses the Tearjewel.
It winds up a punch, but its arms are grabbed by whips
Pencilgon stabs around the body. Kirin tries to stand.
The armor breaks. The spear shatters.
Pencilgon jumpkicks fantasy Sunraku in the neck
She arcs up and above Kirin
A crimson magic circle forms at the tip of her spear. She drives it into the ground.
She javelin throws the spear into Kirin's waist canon
Katzo jumps off of Pencilgon's head, her fists a murky rainbow
She punches the spear. It flies through Kirin and out the other side
The dust clears, and Katzo breathes in front of Kirin
Kirin falls to its knees and collapses
Katzo lies under the rubble of Kirin
Pencilgon smiles and breathes. Kirin dissintegrates.
Katzo and Pencilgon collapse onto the ground.
Lightning strikes kick up more dust
Wind slash. Sunraku falls back. Divine LifeSalve.
Pencilgon and Katzo watch the dust cloud from a distance
The white blade opens, and he sticks the black one inside.
A purple dagger strikes his helmet
Wethermon turns. Pencilgon, Katzo, and Setsuna hide behind the gravestone. He looks at Setsuna, smiling at him below the falling sakura blossoms.
Gold and blue energy press against each other
Chips of metal crumble off of him
The sword flies behind Wethermon and lands in theg round. As sakura blossoms whisp by, the sword cracks in the center and breaks.
A sakura blossom rests in his hand. He slowly closes his fingers.
A couple walks through the field, hand in hand
Walking with Setsuna is a man with long black hair tied up in the back. He has a scruffy mustache and beard.
He turns his brown eyes to Setsuna and smiles.
Setsuna's light brown hair blows in the breeze.
She turns up to him and smiles wide.
The 2 embrace in the poppy field
Text, Even though it was tastier than store-bought, the fact that it looked exactly like store-bought made it creepier. By Mana Iwamaki.
